block_comment: This block of code assigns a constant zero value to a 32-bit signal/variable named "retired_pcb". This operation is performed using the "assign" keyword, typical of continuous assignment in Verilog, implying that "retired_pcb" will always hold the value '0' during the simulation. This could mean that "retired_pcb" represents a cleared or idle state in a PCB (Process Control Block) model in the given context.
